intro: Impatiens petersiana, commonly known as the Petersian balsam, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that come in a variety of colors including pink, red, and white. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are usually heart-shaped and glossy, while its stems are slender and often hairy. Impatiens petersiana thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
